Description: Model axe-head of arsenical copper: of thin sheet metal, schematically shaped. The lugs are not quite properly formed and the cutting end is fully rounded. It is thickly corroded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Abydos, tomb (said to be from) (said to be from)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 119, MG-IV/I.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (116)
